2016.desc: AB Comedy: Sasha chugged an entire liter of ranch.

2014.desc: AB Coffeehouse. Giant inflated ball and incandescent light bulb letters

2014.name: Walk the Moon

2014.name: Mac Miller and Icona Pop
2014.desc: AB Spring Concert. Transforming truck stage and LED wall...I love it!

2013.name: President Suresh's Inauguration
2013.desc: Campus wide celebration to welcome President Suresh

2013.name: Lupe Fiasco
2013.desc: AB Spring Concert. Ludacris cancelled on us for a movie shooting.

2013.name: Judah Friedlander
2013.desc: AB Carnival Comedian, known for his role as Frank on NBC's 30 Rock.

2013.name: International Championships of Collegiate A Cappella
2013.desc: CMU hosts the Great Lakes ICCAs for the first time.

2012.name: Keep Shelly in Athens
2012.desc: AB Underground concert. CMU was the first stop after the band finished playing both weekends of Coachella.

2012.name: Passion Pit (w/ Donora)
2012.desc: Spring Carnival concert. Rain during most of load in didn't stop the show from happening outdoors, which drew a massive crowd of thousands. Dozens and dozens of crowdsurfers, condom balloons, and an epic fireworks display during the encore made for quite a night.

2012.name: BetatraXx (w/ DJ Strobe)
2012.desc: AB Coffeehouse danceparty. Lightwave International ups the bar again and brings every laser left in their inventory that isn't at the Coachella Music Festival, while Tech complements it with a dazzling intelligent & LED rig on the brand new Road Hog.

2012.name: Nick Offerman (w/ Streeter Seidell)
2012.desc: AB Comedian. A well-received opener followed by a very long set by the main act that bordered on being more of an AB Lecture.

2012.name: Kevin Wu (KevJumba)
2012.desc: AB Lectures. A packed lecture hall full of rabid Asian girls flocking to catch a glimpse of the YouTube superstar.

2012.name: Zach Weiner
2012.desc: AB Lectures. The Saturday Morning Breakfast Cereal guy.

2011.name: Tokyo Police Club (w/ 1, 2, 3)
2011.desc: AB Fall Concert. Tech brings in over 10kW of LEDs and drowns the audience in blinding colors.

2011.name: RAC (Remix Artist Collective)
2011.desc: Lightwave International returns for a Halloween show redux, with four lasers this time. Before the show, the operator demonstrates how powerful the concentrated beam from one emitter is – burning a hole through a one-dollar bill folded in half twice in a couple seconds!

2011.name: Annie Sprinkle
2011.desc: AB Lectures. Former prostitute, stripper, and porn star gives an explicit lecture about sex, but is informed by the AB Main chair that performing the topless "Bosom Ballet" in her script wouldn't be such a great idea.

2011.name: Guster
2011.desc: Surprise concert (and fireworks show) held to celebrate the announcement of a $265M donation to CMU by William Dietrich, which is apparently enough to clear the skies of rain.

2011.name: The Hood Internet
2011.desc: AB Coffeehouse show. Some intoxicated and shirtless Pitt gentlemen find their way onto the subs and stage for the entertainment of the audience.

2011.name: Nosaj Thing (w/ Starkey)
2011.desc: AB Coffeehouse show. Dubstep proves to be more than the Rosco 4500 Fogger can handle, which in its final moments pumps a gallon of unfogged fog juice onto the stage.

2011.name: Eddie Griffin
2011.desc: AB Comedian. After consuming an entire bottle of champagne on stage, he grabs his wired SM58 by the cable, swings it over his head, and slams it into the stage -- not 10 seconds after the FoH engineer decides it would be a good idea to enable the compressor on that channel.

2011.name: Big Boi (w/ Brother Ali)
2011.desc: Spring Carnival concert, Hollowood gets admonished for being too loud while some PhD students were taking an exam during soundcheck.

2010.name: Switch (from Major Lazer)
2010.desc: Lightwave International provides 42 watts of lasers for an epic Halloween show, Tech joins the fray and dances in a packed house.

2010.name: White Panda
2010.desc: AB Coffeehouse show, first large dance party with the new VL2500 moving light rig.

2010.name: Michael Ian Black and Michael Showalter
Sleigh Bells
2010.desc: The full KUDO rig had plaster raining from the ceiling, while the entire crowd attempted to get onstage (many were successful), which caused the lead singer's mic to get unplugged and forced an a capella encore.
